Shelter: From south through west to north. Uncomfortable swell with winds from WNW northwards. Very exposed to northeast. Good holding on mind in 3m. Shelving, stone beach.

Uncomfortable on moorings, untenable at anchor, in north easterlies; otherwise safe under all conditions within bay. Pool very exposed from most directions until bank show, then strong northeasterlies may break. In Bay, good holding; dries to mud with stone beach. Boats frequently beach at foot of stones at Gallows Point for access to NWVYC Clubhouse for the scrubbing off.
